description.narrative: To improve rural livelihoods, especially that of women, unemployed youths and the most disadvantaged, in the participating North Eastern States

condition.narrative: Finance Agreement :FA Section II.B.3 | Description :Audited financial statements | Frequency :Yearly
Finance Agreement :PA Section II.A | Description :Project reports | Frequency :Yearly

title.narrative: Complaints received by the complaints unit are addressed following NERLP PIP standards
Project management has satisfactorily addressed satutory audit findings according to agreed NERLP PIP and COM standards
Statutory audit reports are submitted to the Ministry of DoNER and World Bank as required
Periodic MIS Reports being generated by the project
At least 30% of Project SHGs access credit from formal institutions
At least 10% of project households linked to input or output markets
At least 25% of Producer Organizations formed under the project are operational and sustainable
By the end of project, at least 15% of project village level investments come from government, quasi government and community sources
At least 25% of SHG member HHs adopt improved farm and non-farm technologies or improved practices promoted by the project
Of the total para-professionals developed through the project, at least 30% are women
At least 60% of women SHG members achieve a minimum of 30% increased income in real terms by end of project
At least 70% of the project supported HH diversified or up-scaled their income-generating activities
A minimum of 60% of SHG women members have taken at least one loan
CDP Plans financed and implemented in at least 30% of project villages
At least 60% of the Project SHGs achieve “A” Grade.
At least 40% of community institutions promoted by the project have tribal representative
At least 50% of eligible village youth have received training through the project
Partnership is established by the project with at least eight organizations
At least 75% of project supported SHG memebers increase their savings by 50% above their Year 1 levels
At least 50% of women in project area who were not formerly in SHGs become members of Project supported SHGs
At least 90% of SHGs receiving project loans repay them regularly
At least 5% of positions in traditional and formal village institutions are held by members of the most disadvantaged households.
At least 30% of project-benefited unemployed youths are employed
At least 50% of institutions supported by the project are sustainable
